remarks: Transitivity law for lines, one half of ~ tglineelsb2 (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineelsb2.p $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglineelsb2.1 $e |- ( ph -> P e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.4 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
tglineelsb2.3 $e |- ( ph -> S e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.5 $e |- ( ph -> S =/= P ) $.
tglineelsb2.6 $e |- ( ph -> S e. ( P L Q ) ) $.
tglineeltr.7 $e |- ( ph -> R e. B ) $.
tglineeltr.8 $e |- ( ph -> R e. ( P L S ) ) $.
tglineeltr $p |- ( ph -> R e. ( P L Q ) ) $.
